website_summaries.verdict: A tricycle that is good for your infant and will stay useful until he or she is about 5 years old.
pros: Grows with your child: stroller, pushing tricycle, learn-to-ride tricycle, and then a classic tricycle
cons: Components can be a chore to attach and remove

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: My son is 1 year now. Got him this trike for his bday. So I have to put those gray rail around the side so he doesn’t fall over. The problem is that the seat is so slippery his butt keeps on going forward and he can never sit straight and his legs come off the foot rest all the time. I had to put glue on the seat, that way it added more grip and my son is not slipping. Also the steering attachment for the parent keep on loosing grip and collapses all the time. I had to manually drill a screw in that to keep it not collapsing. Didn’t expect this from a $70 trike. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mrinal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect trike
customer_reviews.text: My 17-month old loves this trike! The push handles for parents are very easy to maneuver and are pretty sturdy. I've been using for 3 months several times a day and have yet to experience a problem. I do recommend getting this version with floorboards because they put my mind at ease knowing that her feet aren't dangling/dragging while I'm pushing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle bar for parent does not stay attached to trike.  Product does not work.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second purchase of this toy. The first works the second does not. The handle bar for parent will not stay in. Doesn’t, lock in place. Would like it replaced with working handle. Bought it for my grandsons’s first birthday party. Now remain very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R.D.

customer_reviews.title: Pedals stopped working and handle wobbles
customer_reviews.text: After about 2 years of owning it and when the kid actually needed it (big enough to pedal), we realized the transmission from the pedals to the wheel stopped working sometime along the last 2 years. In other words pedaling does not produce any feedaback: no opposing force and no movement. We should have realized the quality of this product was bad from the beginning, since there was another defect obvious from when we bought it, namely the handle wobbled before having any impact on the wheel direction. Our neighbor has a similar design tricycle and guess what... they have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: ioana

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a “Christmas present” to use with my 9 month old so we could go on walks and he could see a little more than with our big stroller, he’s 29 inches tall and the seat is recommended to be all the way forward for his age but he’s too tall to use the foot rest comfortably with it that far forward. I’ll move it back for him before we use it and that should solve that problem. Assembling this thing was a little frustrating for me but the instructions are pretty simple. No parts were missing It’s easy to steer and I look forward to using it!
customer_reviews.author: Carisa Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Disappointment. Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: Biggest regret purchasing the useless tricycle. I'm 5ft10 and the handle does not extend enough for my height nor does it stay in place while using (gets shorter.) The steering is appalling and I have little success pushing it, especially with the janky handle. I am so mad at having spent the money on this to be this disappointed. Please don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: SaffaExpatLVT

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. I bought this for my 17 month old who isn’t ready for pedals but wants more freedom than stroller. Construction was challenging, as noted by others. Most disappointing was that it is too small for him. Thought the footrest would be great, but he eats his knees with it, very poor design. Can use pedals as footrest with a lot of manipulation of the seat and structure. This will not last him more than one year, to maybe 2-1/2, if that long. Not sure we will keep, a lot of money for one year of use. Radio flyer has been making stuff for kids for 50 years, they really missed it with this item.
customer_reviews.author: FourBoysMom

customer_reviews.title: The perfect uncle gift for niece and nephew
customer_reviews.text: Uncle win, yet again. My niece was first to get the pink 4 in 1 and she loved it. My nephew now at 18 months received his red 4 in 1. The five stars were measured by the smile on his face. He thinks he is so cool being pushed around in his new ride. His sister is so happy for him as she zooms past in her pink version. These are the greatest tricycles and grow with the kids. It truly is a treat watching them enjoy a gift so much. These are well made and every attention to detail is made allowing my comfort knowing these are safe and steady. Uncle gets the point and yes the win!
customer_reviews.author: David Patrick Faustina

customer_reviews.title: Piece of plastic junk
customer_reviews.text: Have bought radio flyer products for years so we bought this for grandson’s first birthday. So disappointed. It is a piece of plastic junk. The handles wobble. They talked like there was away to lock the pedals but does not work. When I called Radio Flyer, they suggested I buy an accessory piece foot rest but from the reviews, I hate to waste more money. Would not refund my money since 30 days had passed but since it was winter, we did not put together right away. I do not see this lasting for 3 or 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H. Roeder

customer_reviews.title: Just got these for my toddler. He loves it ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got these for my toddler. He loves it, although he is in that size range where he is too big to use the footrests and too short to reach the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: By the Seller

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend this product at all!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. In no way is this intended for a young child not on the tricycle portion of this product. My 16 month old son had to become a contortionist to get into this. When I took off the foot rests there is nowhere to put your feet and all he did was drag his feet on the concrete and ruin his sneakers. If you are looking for something for a toddler/infant get the step 2 whisper ride. 100x better and will last longer for your child before he gets on a tricycle
customer_reviews.author: lance r

customer_reviews.title: Loose steering.
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saying everything is tight and put together properly. The steering is extremely loose. When trying to steer your kid away from hitting the curb or other hazards you have to turn the handle over a quarter almost half a turn to counter what the driver is doing. Very annoying to deal with this while on walks.
customer_reviews.author: Mama6thGrade

customer_reviews.title: Good product - seems a bit flimsy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it but I would’ve preferred the foot stand to be included. If you purchase before your child is old enough to have their feet reach the pedals, they have nowhere to keep their feet. My daughters legs were long enough that they couldn’t dangle but short that they couldn’t reach the pedal comfortably. Also she tended to stop using the pedals if she was tired. The foot rest is sold as a separate attachment. The price we pay for this, it can be included. Overall a good product though.
customer_reviews.author: Lux702

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to push and steer. Not the radio flyer quality we know and love.
customer_reviews.text: After less than 5 uses, steering/pushing handle does not stay in place. The part that is supposed to keep it in place is plastic screwed on to plastic which with the force you need to steer and push a child has easily stripped. I attempted to use this now that my child is almost 3 years old and is able to do some of the pedaling by himself, but the handle still slips down. I thought it was just a poor design, but after trying a friend’s little tikes 4-in-1 tricycle, I’m highly disappointed with my decision to go with radio flyer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, tedious assembly- don't do it!
customer_reviews.text: So after the painstaking process of putting this past together, I took my baby girl for a ride (she really likes it) and the damn peddle fell off. The one thing I didn't put together fell off! My daughters legs drag- so the height adjustment is poorly construed. When I turn it, I have to do so super slow or the whole thing will tip over. I'm so disappointed! I read so many reviews, waited and agonized over getting this and after purchasing it- feel regretful as it is not a good product. Doesn't feel safe, reliable or like it's of good quality at all. Waste of money 😡
customer_reviews.author: Mars C.

customer_reviews.title: Junk wheels, junk steering mechanism.
customer_reviews.text: Decent trike, fairly easy to assemble. Major cons: 1. Plastic wheels 2. Play in steering wheel (handle bars move about a quarter inch before front wheel responds) Incredibly disappointed with item 2. It's very, very hard to steer this thing. The front wheel won't respond immediately and often you have to apply a lot of force, which causes the wheel to "snap" into place. The trike will then turn sharply and throws the child off balance. Consider a different item. This one is too difficult to control.
customer_reviews.author: davis

customer_reviews.title: Very small trike... no rubber wheels, odd feet pads
customer_reviews.text: First of if your kid is on the bigger side do not buy it, secondly the stirring handle is low and even if you put it on the highest setting, it goes back down by itself 5 minutes after setting it up
customer_reviews.author: VBraziel

customer_reviews.title: Not great!
customer_reviews.text: The parent steering handle constantly wiggles loose and has to be readjusted and tightened. You can’t get it tight enough to stay in place and there is a lot of wiggle so it doesn’t stear great. It’s also built pretty big to be used for littles as it will be a very long time before they can touch the ground or the petals. There is also more plastic than I’d expect on a radio flyer brand. It doesn’t fold up very small so if you had a car you might not be able to take it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Never going in a store again :-)

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my granddaughter at Christmas 2017. This fall, while strapping her in, we noticed one of the straps had torn away. Today, while examining it, I noticed the other strap had torn away as well. Also, the grip on the handle has rotted, and the handle, from day one, has not engaged and locked, so that you need to continually stop and raise it again and again in order for it to be comfortable to use. It has NOT been used a lot; I’d estimate a dozen times. Really shoddy workmanship; an unsafe product.
customer_reviews.author: Cookbook Crazy

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is perfect for little ones. Our child loves, loves, LOVES this bike. The sun shade works really well and it even works great as a rain cover, the rain doesn’t seep through. The only thing that is a little goofy is when you’re pushing the bike and the handlebars are also being used to steer y your kid it will seem like something is wrong with the bike but nothing is wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: C.R.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have extra tools!
customer_reviews.text: The only bad thing about this was the set up. Parts aren't numbered or labeled and so you have to really look at the pictures an know what part/hardware it is referring to. Also, the clamp for the alignment and steering is almost impossible. My husband, a mechanic, had to use his own tools to rig it to close tight enough to work. Once put together ot worked great. We are currently only using it in the trike mode though. With our younger kids we will have to see how the other parts work when we add them on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 Year olds!
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST for little people who aren't quite ready to ride by themselves. Our twin granddaughters are 27 months old and already have learned how to pedal. We actually tied their feet to the pedals with shoestrings, so they wouldn't slip off. (That would be my only recommendation to the company. Seems like it would be easy enough to add a toe guard on the pedal to slip their feet into until they're ready to pedal alone. ) We will get years out of these bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Galliart

customer_reviews.title: You’d enjoy this if you do not have attention to detail.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Not worth the money... product came with bent parts so the alignment was off, especially with the parent assisting rod. You can’t use the tray unless the seat is at the lowest level. Annoying screw locations that make adjusting the seat a headache. Canopy came bent in several locations, looked and felt very CHEAP. Wasted two hours assembling this.. if you doing pay attention to detail you probably wouldn’t mind the product. But if you want to assemble the product with good alignment and non rattling parts, look for a different product, and let me know if you find one! Pros: seems like good quality plastics and metals for strictly the tricycle. Maybe I received a defective product..
customer_reviews.author: Aamir Refai

customer_reviews.title: My some loves it but you need two hands to push it so my trial run with pushing this while also walking my dog like I do with my stroller was an epic fail
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'6" and the feet kick the back of it with the pole extended all the way. I wish the pole came out further. My some loves it but you need two hands to push it so my trial run with pushing this while also walking my dog like I do with my stroller was an epic fail!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Bernat

customer_reviews.title: No ideal for tall parents.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: easy to assemble Cons: -The handle for parents keep sliding down no matter how hard you tight it up. I currently have it ducked tape in place. - The steering wheel does not respond to the parents handle quickly. There is a difference of about 15 degrees between the movement of the handle for parents and the response of the front wheel, which is quite annoying and difficult for quick corrections on the road. - If you strides are long you may find eventually kicking the back of the stroller. It does not help if the handle slides down as stated previously.
customer_reviews.author: Amutha Selvamani

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves parent hates
customer_reviews.text: So here's the thing: my son (3) loves this. Another thing: I don't. Here's why: - handlebars are too short. I'm 5'6" and it's barely tall enough. As we ride the bars slide down again. - also the angle off the handlebars for the adult leave little foot room. We are removing the basket for more foot room while walking. - I'm definitely skeptical this would last long enough to make it to the tricycle stage. We will keep it because our son refuses to ride in a regular stroller but it's not parent friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Muffin

customer_reviews.title: Radio Flyer make another great product!
customer_reviews.text: My baby granddaughter likes this. She likes being pushed around in it and she also likes to push it around. I am glad my son and daughter like it, as well. He said he didn't like putting it together, it took him a few hours. I will get it again in the future as a gift. It wasn't the cheapest but still cheaper than some others. Plus, it got to them without me paying shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: My 24 month old is so in love with his new bike!!! It is so smooth and easy to steer one handed (while backpack carrying a 2 month old!) *I do have two complaints, I wish the seat could adjust foward and back with a squeeze button of some sort but the two screws have to be removed to adjust. Next they cannot peddle with the grey foot rest in place. When we go on family walks we use the footrest otherwise he pedals around and I have to remove it multiple times a day 👎
customer_reviews.author: Parent

customer_reviews.title: The stroller that grows with your child
customer_reviews.text: This stroller- tricycle grows with your very young child. I bought it for my grandchild at her parents' request. They wanted a tricycle that would adapt as their daughter grew. It was first a ride on toy, pushed by them, and eventually a tricycle she could pedal by herself. It made walks to the local park fun for her, easy for them. They appreciated a ride on cycle that could be grow along with their child's developing skills. One purchase suited a lot of needs.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last too long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this items is February and it is now September and the straps are dry rotted. I don’t think this should have happened within 7 months. Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Millissa Ann Wescoat

customer_reviews.title: The right trike for my grandbaby girls
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I put this trike together in less than an hour, taking snack breaks (we were having fun doing the assembly). My granddaughters were delighted when they came to spend a week with us. Although neither the 1- or 2-year-old can actually fully pedal it, they can only make half a rotation on the wheels, they truly enjoy riding in it, sitting in it, being pushed in it, being put into it and out of it ... super tricycle. Reminds me of my childhood because I had a Radio Flyer, too. Generational excellence on the part of the company. I'm glad to continue to support them.
customer_reviews.author: V. Banks

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: We use this mostly around the neighborhood or quick errands because shes still small so i want her to be comfortable. She loves the tricycle and prefers it over her stroller. She is able to get a 360 view and play with the handle bar. The foot rest/protector protects her feet from touching the wheels so that's a plus. My only issue it that her sippy cup has handles and that does not fit in the cupholder. Other than that, definitely recommend the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: did not like it at all
customer_reviews.text: bought it for my 18 months old daughter and planning to sell it. Likes:- Only thing I like about it is how it looks and assembly instructions. Dislikes:- 1. Base is useless. couldn't adjust her legs on the base so removed it on 1st day itself. 2. parent steering control is poor for me (not very smooth like stroller) 3. Child might interfere the handle/direction 4. Seat doesn't seems to be comfortable for a long ride like 15-20 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Back handle cannot control direction well
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this is only a problem in the one I got. We followed instructions to assemble it. I have to say, assembling is pretty easy. It took us 20 minutes. Buy the handle cannot control direction well. For example, i the center position the car goes to the left a bit. It makes pushing with our daughter on it is so difficult because the direction is kinda not in our control! The problem became worse after 2 months' use. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: One of the wheel cork attachment came pre-installed - incorrectly ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the wheel cork attachment came pre-installed - incorrectly. It’s part #100235, it came installed in reverse. This made it impossible to remove the cork to install it right, so we can put the end cap on.
customer_reviews.author: Balaji

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase of the Year
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking the kids out on walks every day. The older one has a bike, the younger one in the stroller. Now that she has this, it's what she wants to do. I can't even pull it out of the shed, she has to sit on it first and then I take it out. One part I love is that you can disengage the pedals so they don't hit her in the legs when I'm walking her. Great product, well thought out, and safe. Most importantly the kid loves it.
customer_reviews.author: THE MURR

customer_reviews.title: My baby boy loves it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our little boys 1st Birthday. He LOVES it. Now we have only very lightly used it but so far so good. Very light to push and it goes over the bumps on the pavements much easier than his stroller so that’s a huge plus. The little canopy is a great little add on. It’s small but it does the job. Overall (so far) I would recommend this trike.
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran Dermody

customer_reviews.title: No foot rest?! not what I thought i was getting!
customer_reviews.text: This model does NOT have the foot rest. How is that comfortable for kids under 2 (that can’t reach the pedals)?! Their legs are just supposed to dangle? I purchased through amazon instead of target because the shipping was faster and price was the same. But I’ve received an outdated model that is currently not being sold anywhere else. Very disappointed. Already assembled it. My petite 15 month old hates it. It is useless.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Loving these! Better than any stroller for walks!
customer_reviews.text: These were gifts for our twins on their first birthday. Only one understands holding the handles so far, but I have to say we enjoy walks as a family more than when we push their double stroller. The ability to raise and lower the adult handle is helpful between me and my very tall husband. I appreciate that this will grow with the boys for years to come, with the leg protector in these early years into pedals that turn on or off depending if they’re ready to pedal. This is so lightweight it’s easy to pull out of the garage and carry. Weighs less than my toddlers!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Bowsher

customer_reviews.title: Some assembly required
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these this year: one for a girl, one for a boy. They arrived unassembled. Since I chose not to assemble them, extra gift wrap was required for the box, which is heavy. That being said, the kids seem to be having the times of their little lives on the trikes. I love the fact that there is a footrest for those too young to reach the pedals yet. The sunscreen is a nice touch too. Best of all, the children should get some good use out of it as an actual trike when they're big enough to power it on their own.
customer_reviews.author: lyric

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little trike with many features and stages to convert as your child grows. I deducted 1 star due to the foot plate being so close to the seat. Our 1 year old is in the 95 percentile for height, so she has a hard time with her feet and knees hitting the foot plate when the trike is in the stage where you can use the plastic railing to secure your child. Other than that it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 1 year old!
customer_reviews.text: We got this 3 months ago when our daughter was a year old. It came in 1 large box. Took me about a half hour to assemble. Instructions were clear. Need a little muscle to get things tightened properly. The straps are a great feature, keeps our now 15 month old from standing up. The handle used to push and steer isn't extremely sturdy but it works well for it's intended purpose. Overall very pleased with it
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Amaryllis

customer_reviews.title: Grows with your child
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for my son who is now 18 months old. I like that the product can grow with my child. We can easily take it apart (with tools!) and move it wherever we go. What a great memory or the little red radio flyer trike. Hopefully, he has many years of life and many happy memories / pictures to look back on. My husband did mess up putting the seat on (his only job) we are still married but the buckle goes underneath the track of the seat. If not done properly the strap isnt as secure and that can make a parent uneasy. So look out for that.
customer_reviews.author: tara h

customer_reviews.title: This bike was absolutely brilliant for both of our children
customer_reviews.text: This bike was absolutely brilliant for both of our children...until the front wheel stopped working. I went with Radio Flyer in the hopes that the product would last, or at least that they would be available for quality customer service. I've been informed by Radio Flyer customer service that they can indeed replace my front wheel, for the price of $27.95 plus freight. I expected to get more than just a few uses out of this, and am likely to stay away from Radio Flyer products moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Ian McHarg

customer_reviews.title: One of the best 'growing' gizmos for kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our Granddaughters second birthday, she already knew what it was from the picture on the box! She has a lot of kids her same age that have them and she got to use one for a week - and can almost reach the pedals! She was so excited and her parents felt it was the only safeand they research *everything* to make sure it's safe for her to use. Other friends that have kids the same age have said it truly is one of the best stroller to tricycles out there so 5 stars it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great summer trike for cruising the neighborhood- tough to put together
customer_reviews.text: We loved our Radio Flyer trike so much we got this as a gift. It’s very improved over the previous versions. It has feet rests for kids before they get big enough to reach the pedals. On our Trike, we literally used it so much last summer that we almost wore the wheels out. It’s perfect to toss your kid in and walk to the pool. This version has a little trunk that would be perfect for little pool toys or sunscreen. The only reason this gets 4 instead of 5 stars is it is a giant pain to put together. But it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: WeTriedIt

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some other reviewers I did not have any issues with any parts missing or damaged. It all came in nicely packed and in a timely matter. As a matter of fact, my daughter loves it and getting her of that bike could be not an easy task. My only issue with it is a quality of the wheels. It’s plastic! Crappy soft plastic installed of rubber tires. I guess for the price that’s what I get
customer_reviews.author: Astemir B.

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: If my daughter didn’t love it I would have returned it. The handle to steer moves a lot before the front wheel of the trike moves, the straps sit right on my daughters neck and could very easily rub them raw, so I did have to purchase strap covers. It does feel chintzy for the price but my daughter absolutely loves getting pushed around in it or like I said it would have been sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my toddler.
customer_reviews.text: The overall idea seems cool and cute but the sizing is off. I have a 1 1/2 year old toddler and she’s too big for the sit & ride feature but too young for the ride & go feature (obviously she can’t peddle yet). I even pushed the seat all the way back and removed the plate for the feet. She just looks so uncomfortable and her feet just hit the peddles. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The worst. Really bad quality
customer_reviews.text: The worst. Really bad quality. And its hard for toddlers to ride this bike, or tricycle. The pedals hate too hard to move.
customer_reviews.author: Karina K.

customer_reviews.title: Where's my bell
customer_reviews.text: Like the concept being in Arizona the covering is a must in the summer. But you left off the most important thing. No Bike Bell .. the cheaper version with out the covering included the bell. Also the instructions are designed for a 1 year old. Had to take it apart many times to configure for a 2 year old
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M Carolan

customer_reviews.title: We love it but we request one additional feature
customer_reviews.text: My son is 21 month 35 lb and 3 ft big baby. He is ready to paddle but fail to keep his foot on paddle. I wish if you add foot strap to hold his foot on paddle . That will help him and kids like him learn quick. Other change we want is to push handle bar connector . Please make is more firm . Current design is shaky . When kid accidently turn handle bar it over ride direction .
customer_reviews.author: Kunal

customer_reviews.title: Not made like they used too.
customer_reviews.text: Not made like they used too. Cheap plastic in lots of spots and the handle doesn’t stay up while pushing and isn’t right. So you constantly have to move it to keep lined up. So irritating. Disappointed for sure. Definitely paying for the name now and not quality. But the kid loves it and it does what I wanted. Can’t wait till she can ride it herself so I don’t have to deal with the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina M.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandson's first birthday. It assembled easily and quickly. He loves riding it in the baby/infant mode and it is so easy to push. We look forward to him having it for many years as he grows and can ultimately ride it himself. Side note: The marketing of American Flyer an "American Company since 1918" is somewhat ironic in that the box and instructions state "made in China" in many different places. Why can't American make this?
customer_reviews.author: Kim L Blackerby

customer_reviews.title: Not confortable for 2 yr old toddler
customer_reviews.text: So I read reviews before buying and they talked about seat not being comfortable and I could not agree anymore. When I take my son out with it he keeps sliding and fixing himself and he looks very uncomfortable. The material is also very hard, I will be looking into buying some padding for it. Just hate that I have to spend even more, the price is already very steep, should upgrade their material.
customer_reviews.author: Jess K

customer_reviews.title: First leaner...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my little boy while camping. Love the set up. Adjustable lengths to and from the pedals. Made with a protective bar to keep the little ones from falling off, a sun shade and an adjustable seat for while they grow. My little boy is about 32” tall and on the closest setting still can’t reach the pedals but the set up is nice. The shade is a little small and doesn’t keep as much sun off him as I’d like but any larger and it would probably been in his face. It also come with a nice little bin for mommy’s stuff in back. All in all it’s an amazing toy for first learners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really cute but not for 3 and under.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter when she was 1.5 years old. Really bothered me there was no where for her to put her feet while I pushed her. Her feet couldn’t reach the pedals. She is a little over 2 years old now and can almost reach the pedals. Would have loved this bike to have had an option for some kind of stantionary foot rest.
customer_reviews.author: Mcan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my one year old and we absolutely love it. Its easy to assemble and very sturdy. The only aspect I don’t care for is there isn’t a way to lock the handlebars when pushing it like a stroller. My son can still steer when we are pushing him and we will end up off roading.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little weird to assemble maybe just me but In the end I was Able to do it. My son is 1 and lovesssss this bike. He’s on the taller end so he can reach the pedals but obviously too young to pedal so I just Bend his legs down on the foot rests so his feet aren’t hitting the pedals. Other then that great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: We love this bike!
customer_reviews.text: We like this bike! Our son loves it and it’s easy for him to learn on. He is two and so just starting out. When he gets tired or bored, the tall handle is great to push him down the street with! The shade and cup holder are perfect touches for his comfort and the compartment in the back allows him to hide toys or being a snack for the ride. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Yokell

customer_reviews.title: We were missing footrests in this design.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this EXCEPT I wish it had a foot rest for pushing it when they can't reach the pedals. Even parts that could pop in and out but could store away in the little basket. Other than that, it is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Becca & Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers to grow with
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this trike! The feet part attachment that covers the pedals and wheels is genius and makes this toy safe and usable for a two year old. I also like that it has an attachment (that comes off!!) to keep my toddler safely on the trike until I unbuckle him and lift him out.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Maclean

customer_reviews.title: Love multi-phase kid stuff!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 2 year old daughter and she loves it. I am a big fan of any product that will transition with your kid. We started out with the pedals set independently from the wheels, but now she can pedal with the wheel revolutions. We're pretty close to being able to take the adult steering handles off. The only slight negative is that those steering handles are a little loose in comparison to the trike, so there is a bit of a delay/more effort to turn the wheel when you turn the handles. Not sure if it's the design or user assembly error. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia M

customer_reviews.title: but the seat looks pretty uncomfortable as she can't/doesn't sit forward yet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughters first birthday. When she was 12 months to now (15 months) she likes to hang out in it, but the seat looks pretty uncomfortable as she can't/doesn't sit forward yet. Her little legs are also too long for the foot rest but not long enough for pedals so we have to keep an eye on her feet. I look forward to using this more when she's a little older and knows more how to ride a trike.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: VERy happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This was a good buy. Nothing against any other supplier but if you buy I’d get it from Amazon itself. That’s where I got mine and I’m very pleased. It didn’t have anything wrong with it. Every piece every screw!!! Thank you Amazon. My niece loved her birthday gift.
customer_reviews.author: Mzbrizzle

customer_reviews.title: but I just feel like it could have been made better
customer_reviews.text: My 11 mos old loves this, but I just feel like it could have been made better. I worry about it tipping over with him in it. If my 11 mos old reaches for something (a flower as we pass it, for example), it seems like it will tip over if I'm not hanging on properly. I also have a 7 yr old and when she pushes 11 mos old, she has a hard time not tipping it if she turns. Plus, there is no adult drink holder. Seems like a waste, as I live in AZ and don't go on walks without a water for myself. I was a bit disappointed with this expensive purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sarah zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. Just got today for my 16 month old son. Finished putting it together and as I’m looking at it I’m noticing how damaged it is. Suppose to be Brand new, but there is a crack in the cup holder, the seat has a huge gash in it & there are two rips in the canopy... the description also stated it came with a seat cushion & it did not.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for baby
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble. It took roughly an hour or two but only Because I took breaks during the set up. The hardest part was securing the wheels. I love this. It was well worth the money. We bought this when my daughter was 9 months. She enjoys riding it.
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: Fit is small
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 2 year old grandson. Had to remove the foot guard and snack tray as soon as we put it together as it was too small for him to fit into. Once removed he fit the bike well. It is a sturdy bike that was used and abused in it's first 24 hours of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product is good but it has its faults
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is good, but It takes 2hrs to assemble, The steering is adjustable but with very low pressure while pushing it goes down and won't stand in adjusted place. Being tall people its hard for us to push bending more than a 1000ft. The foot rest for small infants is either not enough to comfortably sit or if you remove it, they can't reach the pedal. Its of no use between 32in - 37inch kids
customer_reviews.author: Vinay Mundra

customer_reviews.title: It's okay..
customer_reviews.text: We love it and so does our son. But the quality is lacking and these wheels don't take bumpy terrain or sidewalks very well, keep this in mind. It will throw off the alignment for steering. Also, transportability---- if you have a crossover or larger you may be okay with trekking this along, but generally not the best for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Symone R.

customer_reviews.title: My son loved!
customer_reviews.text: I find not that easy to assemble, but happy with the final results. I took one star off because of the handle to guide the tricycle is not as good as I thought, it kind of delays the movement so I always have to anticipate the movement a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBug

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, we had these before for our twins
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant, we had these before for our twins. There have been some improvements in this version, the only downfall is that our 15 month old is very tall and you can't use the safety rail as the seat won't go back far enough where it will still fit.
customer_reviews.author: SJL1981

customer_reviews.title: Such fun for my little one. :)
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old loves this. It has a harness that keeps her secure and she likes holding on to the handles. It took a little time to out together but after the women took over it went rather smoothly lol. The front "hubcap" pulls out to disengage the pedals so when she gets older she won't try to pedal off without me. The stroller handle is adjustable and is very easy to adjust. I am very pleased with my order and would not hesitate to get another one for another baby down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Jordanlck

customer_reviews.title: Great and toddler loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This trike is great and my toddler loves it! You have to be patient with putting it together because it does take a little time and make sure it’s done right in order to have the best product experience! I read other reviews that it was cheap, but that is absolutely absurd. This is a big winner our book and so glad we made the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty bad, I see rash on my son's feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why is this rated so high. My 18 Months son has hard time keeping feet on paddles and there is no support on bottom , no ledge if kid doesn't want to paddle the feet gets dragged. This is pretty bad, I see rash on my son's feet after first ride. I not sure if this can be returned, going to talk to amazon about it. I would highly recommend not to buy this or buy trikes that have option where your kid can keep feet if they don't wanna paddle some days.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShapper

customer_reviews.title: Good overall.
customer_reviews.text: Our son received this tricycle when he was about 10 months old. It's great except there is no place for a small child to rest their feet. His feet kept dragging on the ground every time we went for a walk. He started reaching pedals when he was about 2 y.o. If there was a footrest it would be a five star product. We've used it through all the stages so far and enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: RockyFan

customer_reviews.title: Great Wheels
customer_reviews.text: The product directions weren't terribly easy to follow, but after a while we were able to figure it out on our own, and we and our now one year old son loves it! I was initially disappointed with how it came. It came wrapped in a plain, unmarked box (not the original), which was great for delivery, but not gifting afterward. Aside, product is well made and was priced better from this seller than anyone else. My son has enjoyed months of rides and will soon be able to advance to the next stage. We look forward to the years worth of fun we will get from this one product.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: perfect 1yr old's birthday present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter"s first birthday. She is obsessed with it! her parents had to put it behind closed doors, until it was time to go on a walk....otherwise she would cry to get back on. Unfortunately the trike is made of plastic...so this will not be passed down, it will be worn out by then. The handles on the back of the trike are great for a shorter person, but I'm 5'7" and the handles would not telescope high enough to make it comfortable. I appreciate the attention to safety and it's relatively easy to buckle her in and out of the trike. Future grandchildren will be receiving their own on their first birthdays, great gift!
customer_reviews.author: dakota4919

customer_reviews.title: Love this trike!
customer_reviews.text: Love this trike! 9 month old grand loves to be outside and this is perfect for walking around.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trike, with a few issues.
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and my two year old enjoys riding this. Assembly is mostly straightforward and easy, but having an extra hand to assembly the rear wheel makes it so much easier. The reason for this are the metal caps that need to be hammered in and deformed into the metal axle rod. However, that is the only difficult part, but enough for 1 star deduction. Additionally, car must be taken to make sure the orientation of the parental handle bars are positioned correctly, but not a big problem. The 2nd star deduction is due to the canopy design. When assembled, the canopy does not provide much if any sun protective coverage, which makes having it pointless.
customer_reviews.author: stakuo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why there are such high reviews on this. The product parental handle is wobbly and keeps coming out. My child keeps slipping off the seat since it’s so small. Also the gray foot rest is so awkwardly made, no child wants to sit with their knees bent like that. I love radio flyer, but this product was extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable footrest
customer_reviews.text: The footrest is really uncomfortable for my 9 month old. He seems to want to put his feet over the footrest. The way his knees have to bend in my opinion, looks quite unnatural. Also, the seatbelt keeps cutting into his neck. On the positive end, the frame is sturdy and overall looks like a good quality bike.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Great brand
customer_reviews.text: not difficult to assemble, and has held up well. Our little one was apparently a little taller than we thought and we had to immediately convert to second stage, but that was easy to do. He loves it, and it is easy to push and steer.
customer_reviews.author: We Don't Rent Pigs

customer_reviews.title: Great product to grow with your child
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to assemble, so be sure to read directions thoroughly. Our granddaughter loves this tricycle. The only downfall is the pedals hit their feet when they are riding if they are in the beginning stages of use, would be better if pedals were detachable as they grew into learning how to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Toria Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great to grow with a toddler.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2 year old who won't stay long in his stroller but likes to go on walks. He loves it. The only problem we had was that it was near impossible to get past the first two steps of the instructions. For those that have this, it requires hammering in a tiny piece on the back to keep the wheels in place. Why they didn't use a screw is beyond me. One that piece was on it took maybe 45 minutes to get the rest assembled. I love the fact that it will grow with him. I think the quality is very good. I thought the wheels would be rubber but they are a durable plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic tires
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the plastic tires instead of rubber tires. I have one with rubber tires and love it so much I wanted one for our granddaughter at home. Very disappointed with the tites.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Friend

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ever.
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo LOVES it. He's 15 months now and one foot can definitely reach the pedal, but the other just dangles for now. Great for little strolls around the neighborhood. We used it since he was 9 months old. He can sit upright and see everything about him, fulfilling his curiosity of the world. It's a little low to push for taller parents probably (I'm 5'4 and it feels low to me). Can't wait to transition it to a trike for him as he gets older! My only other complaint is that when they're younger, it kinda looks uncomfortable that their feet dangles. Wish there was some sort of removable footrest for the younger ones.
customer_reviews.author: CrispyRN

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great! Perfect for my one year old and I see him using it for another year or two.
customer_reviews.text: My one year old son loves this bike. The handle for the parent works well. I can see this bike growing with him for another year or two until he is riding with just training wheels. My son also loves the cup holder and toy box on the back. This product was easy enough to assemble. My husband got it together in less than one hour and it included all tools needed. I can't say enough good things about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cant stop pedals from turning and hitting my grandson's feet
customer_reviews.text: Basically pleased but purchased for my one year old grandson. Not sure if our trike is defective but the pedals keep turning even after engaging the mode to coast and the pedals keep hitting his little feet as he is too young to understand that he needs to keep his feet on the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use for a 2 yr old
customer_reviews.text: He doesn't need all the safety straps etc. but he likes riding on it as a stroller. He hasn't figured out the pedaling yet since he can't quite reach the pedals comfortably, esp. when turning. But, it's a great multi-use tricycle.
customer_reviews.author: T. Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be Happier!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this trike. Our 10 month old hates his stroller so we bought this as an alternative and he loves it. Assembly took just a few minutes. It's easy to control using the steering lever. My husband and I are both under six foot so the length of the lever is not an issue for us but I can see where it might be a bit short for someone taller. We can put a small snack and sippy cup on the tray. The compartment in the back is not large but is big enough to store a small toy, sunblock, your phone etc. Overall, this has been a life saver for use and makes outings so much more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: DHarris

customer_reviews.title: Great Trike for all stages
customer_reviews.text: I got this trike for my child when he was around 10 months. He enjoys being in the tricycle and it's compact enough that we can bring it around in the back of our SUV. I like how the trike has different settings and you can change it to accommodate to the age and size of your child. My only complaint is that we have been using it pretty regularly for about two months now and the tires look a little worn. The tread is starting to wear. It's not too thin just yet but I wonder how it will look in about a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Halo5

customer_reviews.title: Straps and steering is a bit off
customer_reviews.text: Overall cute and does its job. I don’t like how you have to use 2 hands to steer because it has a lot of slack. The straps slip off my sons shoulders even when tightly fastened. The seat is a bit awkward and so is the footrest causing him to sit in a weird position but we don’t have him in very long so it’s fine.
customer_reviews.author: Aida

customer_reviews.title: A giant pain and not very well made
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think this bike is gonna last years for my kids to use it as a regular trike. Its very cheapy made and also came in a thousand pieces. Its very flimsy and I just cannot see it lasting very long. I would of just returned it but it took forever to put together I wouldn’t be able to get all the pieces back in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: This is a great combination. I love that I can push my child if they get tired. Also not a bad price. Only thing is even with the safety straps on my kid slide forward. I have to put something on the seat so there is no sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Lovely

customer_reviews.title: There might be better out there...
customer_reviews.text: This is not a terrible product but my 16 month old son doesn't use the pedals yet and his feet drag along the ground - would be better if there was somewhere for his feet to sit on, also there is no lock on the pedals so the pedals move and hit his feet as well. A lot of it seems like cheap plastic crap - if it wasn't such a pain I'd return it and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, weak umbrella
customer_reviews.text: The bike and set up is good but I am very disappointed in the umbrella. First off, the hinge already broke. Not sure how this happened but this is only three months old and kept inside and in a closet when not in use. Also the height of the umbrella is too short to be used too much into a child's life. Our son is not even two and he hardly fits under it. The whole reason we purchased this unit was for the shade as we live in Texas. I hope that radio flyer reaches out and could offer a replacement umbrella at least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's first birthday, and he is now three. He can pedal it by himself but still needs a little help up hills. This trike grows up well and still looks shiny and bright. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller/tricycle
customer_reviews.text: My 15 month old loves this tricycle , we use it to go on walks. He no longer feels left out when his older brothers ride their bikes. It is sturdy and I like the little storage box at the bottom and the cup holder.
customer_reviews.author: Aisha Khan

product_meta.title: Radio Flyer 4-in-1 Stroll 'N Trike
product_meta.description: Style:BaseThe 4-in-1 Trike is the ultimate Grow-with-Me Trike. It offers 4 ways to ride, to accommodate ages 9 months to 5 years: it easily converts from a stroller to a steering trike, learning-to-ride-trike, and finally a classic trike. The 4-in-1 Trike features safety features for the youngest riders, including removable wrap around safety bars with cupholder and snack tray, and a 3-point harness. The trike has quiet ride tires when pedaling. The height-adjustable push-handle and unique stroller-style canopy remove for older riders. The sturdy steel frame and adjustable seat ensure it will last for years. Surface wash only
feature_bullets: 4 TRICYCLES IN 1: This tricycle grows with your child through different riding stages, making it the ideal learn-to-pedal vehicle. Easily convert between 4 growing stages by removing the accessories
AGES 9 MONTHS TO 5 YEARS: The 4 stages include toddler trike (9 mos. – 18 mos.), steering trike (18 mos. – 24 mos.), learn-to-ride trike (2 – 3 yrs.), and classic trike (4 – 5 yrs.)

REMOVABLE ACCESSORIES: The removable accessories allow this tricycle to grow with your child. The accessories include an adjustable UV protection canopy, wrap around tray, headrest and seat belt, and parent push handle
GREAT FOR OUTDOOR USE: UV protection canopy protects from the sun. High density foam tires provide a quiet and smooth ride
PARENT-CONTROLLED STEERING: The height adjustable parent push handle provides easy control. The foam grip adds comfort. The push handle is removable for when the child can ride on their own

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,408 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
